brief_summary.textblock: The Smart Bipolar RCT is a pragmatic RCT aiming to investigate effects of smartphone-based add on treatment in large scale clinical practice (N= 1000 patients).

detailed_description.textblock:
Bipolar disorder is a complex illness with a complex treatment that differs during manic, depressed and remitted states, frequently leaving patients with decreased quality of life and impaired psychosocial function. IT solutions has during recent years emerged as a possible way to optimize treatment, but the effects of digital health interventions are rarely investigated scientifically in health care services.
This is an application from the entire Mental Health Services, Capital Region of Denmark including all psychiatric centers in the region. The Smart Bipolar randomized controlled trial is a pragmatic trial aiming to investigate the effects of smartphone-based add on treatment in large scale clinical practice (N= 1000 patients). Findings from the study will have great impact on future IT monitoring and treatment in bipolar disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily self-reported mood instability via Monsenso
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study peirod of 6 months per participant
primary_outcome.description: Mood measured daily via smartphones on a scale form -3 to +3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Risk of hospitalization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period of 6 months per participant
secondary_outcome.description: Data on hospitalization according to data from the population-based Danish Psychiatric Central Research Register will be collected and analyzed with survival statistics. Assessed blinded for the intervention status.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Hamilton Depression Scale-17 items
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of clinician evaluated depressive symptoms. Range from 0-52. Higher score means higher severity of depressive symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Young Mania Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of clinician evaluated manic symptoms. Range 0-60. Higher score means higher severity of manic symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Functional Assessment Short Test
secondary_outcome.description: Clinician evaluated Psychosocial Functioning. Higher score means higher impairment of functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life according to WHO Quality of Life-BREF
secondary_outcome.description: Scored between 0-100. Higher scores indicate higher quality of life. Patient evaluated

secondary_outcome.measure: Recovery according to Recovery Assessment Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Higher scores indicate higher level of recovery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Empowerment according to Rogers empowerment scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Higher scores indicate higher empowerment.

secondary_outcome.measure: General well-being according to the WHO (Five) well-being index
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Scores between 0-25. Higher score indicate higher well being.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived stress according to Cohen's Perceived stress scale
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Scores between 0-40. Higher score indicate higher perceived stress.

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with care according to scores on the Verona Satisfaction Scale-Affective Disorder
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Higher scores indicate higher satisfaction with treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction with care according to scores on the Danish nation-wide patient satisfaction questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Patient evaluated. Higher scores indicate higher satisfaction with treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence to the Danish national guidelines of medical treatment of bipolar disorder according to use of the three main maintenance mood stabilizers for bipolar disorder: lithium, lamotrigine or quetiapine and the use of antidepressants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the entire study period of 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to medication will be an additional outcome measure in arms 1 and 2 of the RCT based on daily self-monitoring of medication via the Monsenso system.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinicians' satisfaction with their work at start and end of the RCT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients in CAG Bipolar, i.e., with a main diagnosis of bipolar disorder in the five large centers, in the Mental Health Services, Capital Region of Denmark (Psychiatric Center Copenhagen, Psychiatric Center Hilleroed, Psychiatric Center Amager, Psychiatric Center Glostrup and Psychiatric Center Ballerup)
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
